intro: Dendromyza cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in early spring. Dendromyza cuneata is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments.
